name: MOH Non-Residential Long-Term Care Subsidy
shortDescription: Defrays cost of long-term care services for persons living in the community
description: Defrays cost of long-term care services for persons living in the community
benefits: Up to 80% subsidy on non-residential long-term care facilities such as dementia day care and home-based care.
eligibility:
- User of Non-Residential Long-Term Care service in a Singapore Citizen (SC) or Permanent Resident (PR)
- The service provider is government-funded
- Subsidy tiers are based on monthly household per capita income. Click [here](https://www.moh.gov.sg/managing-expenses/schemes-and-subsidies/subsidy-framework-for-non-residential-long-term-care-services) to check the subsidy level you may be eligible for.
nextSteps: 1. Approach your doctor at the hospital or polyclinic, or AIC to apply for admission to a subsidised Non-Residential LTC service

name: Caregivers Training Grant
shortDescription: Supports caregivers (family, foreign domestic workers) attending approved courses on providing care.
description:
Supports caregivers (family, foreign domestic workers) attending approved courses on providing care.

More information [here](https://www.aic.sg/financial-assistance/caregivers-training-grant-ctg/).
benefits: Up to $400 in the first year, followed by $200 annually. The amount will be applied directly to offset course fees.
eligibility: This eligibility checker will be built soon. Meanwhile, click [here] to view eligibility criteria
nextSteps:
**1. Complete the Caregiver Training Grant form [here](https://www.aic.sg/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/CTG-Application-form.pdf)**.
Be sure to provide the requested documents:
- Care Recipient's NRIC / Birth Certificate
- Caregivier's NRIC

**2. Select an approved course from the list [here](https://training-healthcare.vertis.digital/)**. Provide the completed form to the training provider at least 2 weeks before the course begins.

name: Home Caregiving Grant
shortDescription: Defrays caregiving costs for eligible individuals with permanent moderate disability living in the community
description: Defrays caregiving costs for eligible individuals with permanent moderate disability living in the community
benefits: Up to S$400 monthly cash payout
eligibility: This eligibility checker will be built soon. Meanwhile, click [here] (https://www.aic.sg/financial-assistance/home-caregiving-grant-hcg/) to view eligibility criteria.
nextSteps:
1. Complete Means Testing [here](https://www.homes.gov.sg/eservice/) to verify your eligibility.

2. Obtain a [Functional Assessment Report](https://www.aic.sg/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Functional-Assessment-Report.pdf) from your GP or care provider. The cost of the Report will vary from provider to provider.

3. Apply for the the Home Caregiving Grant [here](https://cp.efinance.aic.sg/) when steps 1 and 2 are completed and your eligibility has been confirmed.

name: Parent Relief
shortDescription: Recognises individuals who are supporting their parents, grandparents, parents-in-law or grandparents-in-law in Singapore.
description:
Recognises individuals who are supporting their parents, grandparents, parents-in-law or grandparents-in-law in Singapore.

More information [here](https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/individual-income-tax/basics-of-individual-income-tax/tax-reliefs-rebates-and-deductions/tax-reliefs/parent-relief-parent-relief-(disability))
benefits: Up to $9,000 tax relief per dependant. Claimable for up to 2 dependants.
eligibility: This eligibility checker will be built soon. Meanwhile, click [here] (https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/individual-income-tax/basics-of-individual-income-tax/tax-reliefs-rebates-and-deductions/tax-reliefs/parent-relief-parent-relief-(disability)) to view eligibility criteria
nextSteps:
**1. Consider if your dependant(s) is/are eligible for [Parent Relief (Disability)](https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/individual-income-tax/basics-of-individual-income-tax/tax-reliefs-rebates-and-deductions/tax-reliefs/parent-relief-parent-relief-(disability))**
- This provides up to $14,000 in tax relief per dependant 
- Requires an additional form to be submitted and documentation of disability 

**2. After you receive your Notice of Assessment in 2025, follow these steps if it is your first time claiming Parent Relief**

a) Log in with your Singpass or Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA) at myTax Portal.

b) Go to "Individuals" > "File Income Tax Return".

c) Select "File" to File Income Tax Return.

d) Go to "4. Deductions, Tax Reliefs and Rebates".

e) Select "Add New" > "Parent".

f) Fill in the relevant information and select "Update"
